meanings.definition: The killing of a large number of people, especially in a brutal manner.
meanings.sent1: The massacre in the movie was very sad.
meanings.sent2: The village was in shock after the brutal massacre.
meanings.sent3: The children's game of pretend massacre was quite dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The massacre of trees by the storm left a devastating landscape.
meanings.sent5: The history book vividly described the massacre of the soldiers.

meanings.definition: To kill a large number of people in a brutal manner.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers planned to massacre the enemy troops.
meanings.sent2: The dictator ordered his army to massacre the civilians.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly said he would massacre the vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The virus seemed to massacre the cells in the body.
meanings.sent5: The angry mob wanted to massacre anyone in their path.
